ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Proficiency in speaking and writing Hindi.
The ability to speak, write, and understand hindi more fluently. Also, I learned more about indian culture.
Worked on reading, listening, writing, and speaking in Hindi.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is incredible and the professors are incredibly dedicated. I have nothing to say regarding weaknesses.

Strengths: Kind, accommodating professors who are clearly very invested in helping you learn. There's plenty of individualized instruction available if you want it. The journal entries are good and I like that we're able to write about whatever we want to. 

Weaknesses: Organization. Would really like to see more organization and intention behind the plan for each class. Often felt like classes didn't have much direction. And it can be frustrating to stick so closely to a textbook. I feel like I could be doing most of this on my own if all we're going to do is exercises from a book. More verbal repetition (even if I get it right once doesn't mean I've actually internalized the lesson!) and games or engagement in class would be great. Maybe more consistency with homework, too. Would also maybe like more vocab tests and more simple grammar repetition on the quizzes. 

The major way that this course could be improved is to hire more faculty for the Hindi language department. Two professors is not enough. Swapna ji and Savita ji are doing far more than their fair share of work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I think this was a tough class with the remote L1, and L2 students finally coming in person. And Savita-ji was adjusting.

Absolutely. You get out what you put in, and hindi is a community of its own. Both professors care about your well-being and development within the courseSwapna ji has been helping me at office hours over L1/L2/L3 and is by far one of my favorite teachers.
